meanings.definition: To give intellectual, moral, and social instruction to someone.
meanings.sent1: Parents educate their children at home.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl decided to educate the young squirrels on the dangers of flying kites near trees.
meanings.sent4: Books have the power to educate minds and open new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The documentary aimed to educate viewers about the importance of recycling.

meanings.definition: To provide information or training to someone.
meanings.sent1: The museum staff educate visitors about the history of the artifacts.
meanings.sent2: Online courses educate individuals on various subjects.
meanings.sent3: The friendly robot was programmed to educate astronauts on space exploration.
meanings.sent4: Experience can educate us in ways that textbooks cannot.
meanings.sent5: The mentor took it upon himself to educate the new employees about company policies.

meanings.definition: To develop the faculties and powers of someone by teaching.
meanings.sent1: Sports coaches educate athletes on proper techniques.
meanings.sent2: Music teachers educate students on how to read sheet music.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit decided to educate the other animals on the art of disappearing.
meanings.sent4: Life experiences can educate us about resilience and adaptability.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance helped educate the apprentice in the art of woodworking.
